This example tutorial illustrates:
Tutorial WIKI
http://wiki.eclipse.org/EclipseLink/Examples/JPA/JBoss_Web_Tutorial
Demo URL:
http://127.0.0.1:8080/enterprise/FrontController?action=demo

- Deployment of a simple servlet client based JPA EAR application on the JBoss 6.0.0M1 Server
- No use of a Web application framework like JSF, Struts or client side Ajax - to minimize setup conflicts - Pure JPA - no native ORM at this point unless required as a workaround for the container - Container managed entity manager where possible - except for DDL generation - Smallest entity model possible - a single entity with a @ManyToMany to itself - Entity model has no container specific annotations - Use of a transactional container managed JPA EclipseLink entityManager on a stateless session bean
- How to integrate with the Eclipse IDE

* The demo will run out of the box with the DefaultDS HQSL datasource provided you have copied eclipselink.jar to the \common\lib directory.
* When using HSQL on JBoss - DDL generation may be turned on and run on the container
* as opposed to creating the schema externally or using an SE app like server.common.ddlgen
*
* NOTE:
* To aide in providing a complete end-to-end runnable demo - DDL generation is on
* The persistence unit used by this application performs its own DDL generation.
* The database tables will be deleted and regenerated on every deployment,
* therefore you should - when working with this demo - remove the ddl generation properties in persistence.xml
* when you are done with them. Otherwise you may get the following when running the demo the 2nd time.
* Internal Exception: java.sql.SQLException: S1000 General error java.lang.RuntimeException: prepared statement is no longer valid



Requirements:
- JBoss 5.1.0 or 6.x
- A database (The JBoss HSQL default datasource is used by this example)
- an HTML browser

Modifications:
- modify persistence.xml for your particular database if not using HSQL
